title: bug of Variable when building from source
body_html:
When I build the pytorch from latest source, a very unreasonable bug appears.

import torch from torch.autograd import Varibale a = Variable(torch.Tensor(3,4)) print(a)
The output shows that a is a Tensor but not a Variable? Why??

-3.4105e-05 4.5729e-41 -3.4105e-05 4.5729e-41 1.4047e-35 3.0943e-41 0.0000e+00 0.0000e+00 2.8175e+20 4.5559e-41 -9.0001e-06 4.5729e-41 [torch.FloatTensor of size (3,4)]

the torch version is 0.4.0a0+cd21127
body_text:
When I build the pytorch from latest source, a very unreasonable bug appears.
import torch from torch.autograd import Varibale a = Variable(torch.Tensor(3,4)) print(a) 
The output shows that a is a Tensor but not a Variable? Why??
-3.4105e-05  4.5729e-41 -3.4105e-05  4.5729e-41 1.4047e-35  3.0943e-41  0.0000e+00  0.0000e+00 2.8175e+20  4.5559e-41 -9.0001e-06  4.5729e-41 [torch.FloatTensor of size (3,4)]
the torch version is 0.4.0a0+cd21127
body:
When I build the pytorch from latest source, a very unreasonable bug appears.

`import torch
from torch.autograd import Varibale
a = Variable(torch.Tensor(3,4))
print(a)
`
The output shows that a is a Tensor but not a Variable? Why?? 

`-3.4105e-05  4.5729e-41 -3.4105e-05  4.5729e-41
 1.4047e-35  3.0943e-41  0.0000e+00  0.0000e+00
 2.8175e+20  4.5559e-41 -9.0001e-06  4.5729e-41
[torch.FloatTensor of size (3,4)]`

the torch version is `0.4.0a0+cd21127`
